cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I feel the presence of the God-Pharaoh in the Second Sun, and I rise upon its rays."

rulings.text: Giving a creature flying after it's already been blocked won't change or undo that block. If you want to affect what can block the creature, you must cast Mighty Leap during the declare attackers step at the latest.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Militia Bugler
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
When Militia Bugler enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card with power 2 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
cards.originalText: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.) When Militia Bugler enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card with power 2 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Novice Knight
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
As long as Novice Knight is enchanted or equipped, it can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: Even the greatest hero begins with nothing.

rulings.text: Once Novice Knight has attacked, it will remain in combat even if it's no longer enchanted or equipped.

cards.originalText: Defender (This creature can't attack.) As long as Novice Knight is enchanted or equipped, it can attack as though it didn't have defender.

cards.name: Oreskos Swiftclaw
cards.flavor: The leonin of Oreskos are quick to take offense—not because they are thin-skinned, but because they are always ready for a fight.

cards.name: Pegasus Courser
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Pegasus Courser attacks, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Pegasus Courser attacks, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Remorseful Cleric
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Remorseful Cleric: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: A lifetime of keeping up appearances is not enough to earn an eternity of rest.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice Remorseful Cleric: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Resplendent Angel
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained 5 or more life this turn, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying and vigilance.
{3}{W}{W}{W}: Until end of turn, Resplendent Angel gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink.

rulings.text: Resplendent Angel's triggered ability checks if you gained 5 or more life total during the turn. It doesn't matter if you also lost life or whether your life total is greater than it was at the beginning of the turn. It also doesn't matter whether Resplendent Angel was on the battlefield when any of the life gain happened.
You don't need to have gained 5 life all at once to satisfy Resplendent Angel's triggered ability.
If you didn't gain life during the turn before the end step begins, Resplendent Angel's triggered ability won't trigger at all. Gaining life during the end step won't cause the ability to trigger.
You create only one Angel token, no matter how many times you gained 5 or more life.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate won't satisfy Resplendent Angel's triggered ability, even though it caused your team's life total to increase.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained 5 or more life this turn, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying and vigilance.
{3}{W}{W}{W}: Until end of turn, Resplendent Angel gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink.

cards.name: Revitalize
cards.text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"A potion is no substitute for a skilled surgeon, but it will hold your bits in."
—Torricks, battlefield medic
cards.originalText:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Rustwing Falcon
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Native to wide prairies and scrublands, falcons occasionally roost in dragon skeletons.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Shield Mare
cards.text:
Shield Mare can't be blocked by red creatures.
When Shield Mare enters the battlefield or becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: When it passes, order defeats chaos.
cards.originalText:
Shield Mare can't be blocked by red creatures.
When Shield Mare enters the battlefield or becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Star-Crowned Stag
cards.text: Whenever Star-Crowned Stag attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.
cards.flavor: White as starlight on snow, it appears only on the eve of the winter solstice.
cards.originalText: Whenever Star-Crowned Stag attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

cards.name: Suncleanser
cards.text:
When Suncleanser enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Remove all counters from target creature. It can't have counters put on it for as long as Suncleanser remains on the battlefield.
• Target opponent loses all counters. That player can't get counters for as long as Suncleanser remains on the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the cost of an ability or an additional cost of a spell requires putting counters on a creature or player affected by Suncleanser, that cost can't be paid. If a resolving spell or ability says that a player may give counters to that creature or player, that player can't choose to do so.

If a replacement effect allows a player to modify or replace an event by putting counters on a creature or player affected by Suncleanser, that player may apply that replacement effect, but they won't get counters. If the original event is entirely replaced (such as by applying Soul-Scar Mage's replacement effect), the original event won't happen.

Damage from a source with wither has no effect on an affected creature. No -1/-1 counters are put on them, and no damage is marked on them. The damage is still dealt for purposes of effects that care about damage, such as lifelink.

Damage from a source with infect has no effect on an affected creature or player. No -1/-1 counters are put on creatures, and no damage is marked on them. Players don't get poison counters and they don't lose life. The damage is still dealt for purposes of effects that care about damage, such as lifelink.

While resolving a cumulative upkeep trigger of an affected creature, you'll fail to put a counter on that permanent, then you may pay for the age counters already on it. If it has no age counters on it, you may pay {0}.

cards.originalText:
When Suncleanser enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Remove all counters from target creature. It can't have counters put on it for as long as Suncleanser remains on the battlefield.
• Target opponent loses all counters. That player can't get counters for as long as Suncleanser remains on the battlefield.

cards.name: Take Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: "Your death will be a balm, your passing a welcome revision, and all will sigh with peace to know of your demise."
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Trusty Packbeast
cards.text: When Trusty Packbeast enters the battlefield, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Margaret has traveled with me to the end of the world and back."
—Hewen Frit, merchant
cards.originalText: When Trusty Packbeast enters the battlefield, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Valiant Knight
cards.text:
Other Knights you control get +1/+1.
{3}{W}{W}: Knights you control gain double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Defeat is no reason for retreat. It is a sign we must redouble our efforts to win this fight."

rulings.text: Multiple instances of double strike on the same creature are redundant.

Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a Knight you control may become lethal if Valiant Knight leaves the battlefield during that turn.

cards.originalText:
Other Knights you control get +1/+1.
{3}{W}{W}: Knights you control gain double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Aether Tunnel
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: If you can't find a doorway, make one.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and can't be blocked.

cards.name: Anticipate
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: Divining the future is easy when you hold the power to sway it.
cards.originalText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Aven Wind Mage
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Aven Wind Mage gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "My skill sharpens with each beat of my wings."

rulings.text: Aven Wind Mage's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Aven Wind Mage gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Aviation Pioneer
cards.text: When Aviation Pioneer enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: "They say perfection is unattainable, but they said that about flight too."
cards.originalText: When Aviation Pioneer enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

cards.name: Bone to Ash
cards.text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

rulings.text: A creature spell that can't be countered is a legal target for Bone to Ash. The creature spell won't be countered when Bone to Ash resolves, but you'll still draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: "I decide what stands in my way."
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Departed Deckhand
cards.text:
When Departed Deckhand becomes the target of a spell, sacrifice it.
Departed Deckhand can't be blocked except by Spirits.
{3}{U}: Another target creature you control can't be blocked this turn except by Spirits.

rulings.text: You'll sacrifice Departed Deckhand even if you counter the spell that targets it.
If the spell that targets Departed Deckhand has no other targets, it won't resolve (because it no longer has a legal target after Departed Deckhand is sacrificed).
Activating Departed Deckhand's last ability after a creature has become blocked by a non-Spirit creature won't cause that creature to become unblocked.

cards.originalText:
When Departed Deckhand becomes the target of a spell, sacrifice it.
Departed Deckhand can't be blocked except by Spirits.
{3}{U}: Another target creature you control can't be blocked this turn except by Spirits.

cards.name: Disperse
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It's pointless to hold on when you have nothing to hold on with.
cards.originalText: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "The stars mark your destiny. May you accept the fate thus divulged."
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Djinn of Wishes
cards.text:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

rulings.text: If you wish to play the exiled card, you must play it while the last ability of Djinn of Wishes is resolving. You can't play it later in the turn. A spell cast this way may be cast at a time you normally wouldn't be able to cast a spell of that type, but other restrictions (such as "Cast this spell only during combat") are enforced.
If the revealed card is a land, you can play it only if it's your turn and you haven't yet played a land this turn.

If you cast a spell "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs. You can, however, pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Tormenting Voice, those must be paid to cast the card.
If a spell has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

cards.name: Dwindle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -6/-0.
When enchanted creature blocks, destroy it. (The attacking creature remains blocked.)
cards.flavor: The collection didn't have room to expand, so the wizard improvised a solution.

rulings.text: Once the enchanted creature is destroyed, the attacking creature won't assign or deal combat damage unless it has trample or is being blocked by another creature.

cards.originalText: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets -6/-0. When enchanted creature blocks, destroy it. (The attacking creature remains blocked.)

cards.name: Essence Scatter
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: Dependence on luck is anathema to Kefnet's rigorous studies. Those who hope to escape his maze by chance never succeed.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Exclusion Mage
cards.text: When Exclusion Mage enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Successful battles start with knowing who's worth fighting.
cards.originalText: When Exclusion Mage enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Frilled Sea Serpent
cards.text: {5}{U}{U}: Frilled Sea Serpent can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Reel it in. No, wait! Throw it back!"
—Gertrude, deep-sea angler

rulings.text: Once Frilled Sea Serpent has been blocked, activating its ability won't change or undo that block.

cards.originalText: {5}{U}{U}: Frilled Sea Serpent can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Gearsmith Prodigy
cards.text: Gearsmith Prodigy gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.
cards.flavor: Young artificers on Kaladesh let their imaginations run wild.
cards.originalText: Gearsmith Prodigy gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.

cards.name: Ghostform
cards.text: Up to two target creatures can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "Picking locks is for beginners."
cards.originalText: Up to two target creatures can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Horizon Scholar
cards.text:
Flying
When Horizon Scholar enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.originalText: Flying When Horizon Scholar enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Metamorphic Alteration
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Metamorphic Alteration enters the battlefield, choose a creature.
Enchanted creature is a copy of the chosen creature.

rulings.text: You can choose only a creature on the battlefield.

Metamorphic Alteration copies exactly what is printed on the chosen creature (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it as any counters on it or any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.

The characteristics that will be copied are determined as Metamorphic Alteration's effect first begins to apply. If the copiable values of the chosen creature change later, or if that creature leaves the battlefield, the enchanted creature's characteristics are unaffected.

If the chosen creature isn't normally a creature (for example, if the chosen creature is an animated Treetop Village), the enchanted creature becomes a copy of that noncreature permanent. This causes Metamorphic Alteration to be illegally attached, and it's put into its owner's graveyard. The previously enchanted creature returns to being itself.

If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is enchanted by another Metamorphic Alteration), then the enchanted creature becomes a copy of whatever the chosen creature copied.

If the chosen creature is a token, Metamorphic Alteration copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put the token onto the battlefield. The enchanted creature doesn't become a token in this case.

The enchanted creature will be a copy of the chosen creature as it dies, so any "when this creature dies" abilities it gains from the copy effect will trigger. Any "when this creature dies" abilities it normally has will not trigger.

If Metamorphic Alteration somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, it can't have the enchanted creature become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that's already on the battlefield.

Metamorphic Alteration can cause a creature to become a copy of itself. This generally has no effect, but if that creature has a pair of linked abilities, the new abilities it has from the copy effect aren't linked to the abilities it had before.
The copiable values granted by Metamorphic Alteration are locked in as the creature is chosen. The enchanted creature won't change if the chosen creature's copiable values change.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
As Metamorphic Alteration enters the battlefield, choose a creature.
Enchanted creature is a copy of the chosen creature.

cards.name: Mirror Image
cards.text: You may have Mirror Image enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature you control.
cards.flavor: The life of a shapeshifter is one of constant change.

rulings.text: Mirror Image copies exactly what was printed on the original creature (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it as any counters on it or any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If the copied creature has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Mirror Image), then Mirror Image enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.

If the chosen creature is a token, Mirror Image copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put the token onto the battlefield. Mirror Image doesn't become a token in this case.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Mirror Image enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If Mirror Image somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, it can't become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that's already on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: You may have Mirror Image enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature you control.

cards.name: Mistcaller
cards.text: Sacrifice Mistcaller: Until end of turn, if a nontoken creature would enter the battlefield and it wasn't cast, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: Hospitality is of little concern to those who do not wish to be disturbed.

rulings.text: Mistcaller's ability won't affect any nontoken creatures that were cast, including ones cast from unusual zones such as your graveyard.
Mistcaller's ability doesn't stop creature tokens from entering the battlefield. It also doesn't affect creatures that are already on the battlefield.
If Mistcaller enters the battlefield at the same time as other creatures, its ability can't be activated in time to affect those creatures.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Mistcaller: Until end of turn, if a nontoken creature would enter the battlefield and it wasn't cast, exile it instead.

cards.name: Mystic Archaeologist
cards.text: {3}{U}{U}: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: The delight of discovery drives the pursuit of knowledge.
cards.originalText: {3}{U}{U}: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Omenspeaker
cards.text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.originalText: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Omniscience
cards.text: You may cast spells from your hand without paying their mana costs.
cards.flavor:
"The things I once imagined would be my greatest achievements were only the first steps toward a future I can only begin to fathom."
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: You must follow the normal timing permissions and restrictions of each spell you cast.

If you cast a spell "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to cast it for any alternative costs. You can, however, pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, such as that of Tormenting Voice, those must be paid to cast the card.
If a spell has {X} in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value of X when casting it without paying its mana cost.

Once you cast Omniscience, if it's your turn, you'll have priority immediately after it resolves. You can cast another spell before any player can attempt to remove Omniscience with spells or abilities.

cards.originalText: You may cast spells from your hand without paying their mana costs.

cards.name: One with the Machine
cards.text: Draw cards equal to the highest converted mana cost among artifacts you control.
cards.flavor:
"When I grafted the Planar Bridge into myself I felt my Planeswalker spark flare beyond my body. The Multiverse was my plaything. It felt . . . incredible."
—Tezzeret

rulings.text: If a permanent has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

cards.originalText: Draw cards equal to the highest converted mana cost among artifacts you control.

cards.name: Patient Rebuilding
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard, then you draw a card for each land card put into that graveyard this way.
cards.flavor: Nicol Bolas would not rest until he was restored to his former glory.

rulings.text: Each time Patient Rebuilding's triggered ability resolves, it counts only the land cards put into that graveyard during that ability's resolution. For example, if your opponent puts two land cards into their graveyard during one upkeep and three land cards the next, you'll draw two and three cards, respectively, not two and five.
If your opponent moves cards from their library but they aren't put into their graveyard (perhaps because you control Rest in Peace), you won't draw any cards.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard, then you draw a card for each land card put into that graveyard this way.

cards.name: Psychic Corrosion
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, each opponent puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"To break another's mind is to deliver a fate worse than death. It is a terrifying power."
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: If a spell or ability causes you to put cards into your hand without specifically using the word "draw," Psychic Corrosion's ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever you draw a card, each opponent puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.

cards.name: Sai, Master Thopterist
cards.text:
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
{1}{U}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Industry without artistry is just a fancy way to fill the junkyard."

rulings.text: Sai's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger. It resolves even if that spell is countered.

foreignNames.name: 練達飛行機械職人、サイ

cards.originalText:
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
{1}{U}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Draw a card.

cards.name: Salvager of Secrets
cards.text: When Salvager of Secrets enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The greatest treasure of the deep is an echo from above.
cards.originalText: When Salvager of Secrets enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Scholar of Stars
cards.text: When Scholar of Stars enters the battlefield, if you control an artifact, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "The path of the stars is as reliable as the instruments that measure them."
cards.originalText: When Scholar of Stars enters the battlefield, if you control an artifact, draw a card.

cards.name: Sift
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Skilled Animator
cards.text: When Skilled Animator enters the battlefield, target artifact you control becomes an artifact creature with base power and toughness 5/5 for as long as Skilled Animator remains on the battlefield.

rulings.text: Skilled Animator doesn't remove any abilities the target artifact has.

The artifact retains any types, subtypes, or supertypes it has. Notably, if an Equipment becomes an artifact creature, it can't be attached to another creature. If it was attached to a creature, it becomes unattached.

If the artifact was already a creature, its base power and toughness will each become 5. This overwrites any previous effects that set the creature's base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after Skilled Animator's ability resolves will overwrite this effect.

Effects that modify a creature's power and/or toughness, such as the ones created by Titanic Growth or a +/1+1 counter, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch power and toughness.

The resulting artifact creature will be able to attack on your turn if it's been under your control continuously since the turn began. That is, it doesn't matter how long it's been a creature, just how long it's been on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When Skilled Animator enters the battlefield, target artifact you control becomes an artifact creature with base power and toughness 5/5 for as long as Skilled Animator remains on the battlefield.

cards.name: Sleep
cards.text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage

rulings.text: The second part of Sleep's ability affects all creatures the targeted player controls as Sleep resolves, not only the ones that Sleep actually caused to become tapped.

cards.originalText: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Supreme Phantom
cards.text:
Flying
Other Spirits you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: A king's knowledge does not vanish when the heart stops beating.

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a Spirit you control may become lethal if Supreme Phantom leaves the battlefield during that turn.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Other Spirits you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Surge Mare
cards.text:
Surge Mare can't be blocked by green creatures.
Whenever Surge Mare deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
{1}{U}: Surge Mare gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When it passes, waves touch the sky.
cards.originalText:
Surge Mare can't be blocked by green creatures.
Whenever Surge Mare deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
{1}{U}: Surge Mare gets +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Switcheroo
cards.text: Exchange control of two target creatures.
cards.flavor: Say hello to your new friend.

rulings.text: If one of the target creatures is an illegal target when Switcheroo resolves, the exchange won't happen.
You don't have to control either target.
If the same player controls both creatures when Switcheroo resolves, nothing happens.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Exchange control of two target creatures.

cards.name: Tezzeret, Artifice Master
cards.text:
+1: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
0: Draw a card. If you control three or more artifacts, draw two cards instead.
−9: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, search your library for a permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library."

rulings.text: If you put a permanent onto the battlefield with Tezzeret's emblem's ability, any triggered abilities of that permanent that trigger during your end step won't trigger during that same end step.

foreignNames.name: 工匠の達人、テゼレット

cards.originalText:
+1: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.
0: Draw a card. If you control three or more artifacts, draw two cards instead.
−9: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your end step, search your library for a permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library."

cards.name: Tolarian Scholar
cards.flavor: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.

cards.name: Totally Lost
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.
cards.originalText: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Uncomfortable Chill
cards.text:
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The cold slowed their movements until only their panicked eyeballs swiveled beneath the ice.
cards.originalText:
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Wall of Mist
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: The seafloor is flecked with the bones of fools who dared to sail into the mist.
cards.originalText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.name: Windreader Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying attacks, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Your mind is too filled with foolish concerns to hear the subtle whispers that the breeze brings."

rulings.text: It doesn't matter who controls the creature with flying or which player or planeswalker that creature is attacking. Windreader Sphinx's controller is the player who may draw a card.
Windreader Sphinx's ability will trigger when it itself attacks.

The creature must have flying immediately after being declared as an attacking creature in order for Windreader Sphinx's ability to trigger. For example, attacking with Kitesail Corsair will cause the ability to trigger, and attacking with Pegasus Courser and a creature without flying will cause the ability to trigger only once.

foreignNames.name: 風読みのスフィンクス

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying attacks, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Abnormal Endurance
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains "When this creature dies, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control."
cards.flavor: Tenacity prevails when hopes die.

rulings.text: Abnormal Endurance's effect works only once. If the targeted creature dies and is then returned to the battlefield, it's considered to be a new creature. If that new creature dies, it won't come back.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains "When this creature dies, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control."

cards.name: Blood Divination
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Predicting the future is a messy business.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast Blood Divination; you can't cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can't sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can respond only after Blood Divination has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.

cards.name: Bogstomper
cards.flavor:
"They are gentle herbivores, despite their size. Approach cautiously, and hum a tune to let them know you mean no harm."
—Vivien Reid

cards.name: Bone Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{B}{B}, Exile seven other cards from your graveyard: Return Bone Dragon from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Its roar is the clatter of a thousand bones.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}{B}{B}, Exile seven other cards from your graveyard: Return Bone Dragon from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.
cards.originalText: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Death Baron
cards.text: Skeletons you control and other Zombies you control get +1/+1 and have deathtouch.
cards.flavor: For the necromancer barons, killing and recruitment are one and the same.

rulings.text: A creature that's both a Skeleton and a Zombie will get the bonus only once.
Death Baron doesn't normally affect itself. If you manage to turn it into a Skeleton, however, then it will give itself +1/+1 and deathtouch.

Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a Skeleton or Zombie you control may become lethal if Death Baron leaves the battlefield during that turn.

cards.originalText: Skeletons you control and other Zombies you control get +1/+1 and have deathtouch.

cards.name: Demon of Catastrophes
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Flying, trample
cards.flavor: A pit yawned open, a column of oily smoke arose, and a towering form hissed, "I accept this offering."

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast Demon of Catastrophes; you can't cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can't sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can respond only after Demon of Catastrophes has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Flying, trample

cards.name: Diregraf Ghoul
cards.text: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.originalText: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Doomed Dissenter
cards.text: When Doomed Dissenter dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: There is only one fate left to those banished from the God-Pharaoh's city.
cards.originalText: When Doomed Dissenter dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"It hurts more if you think about it."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Epicure of Blood
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: "Fleshy, with just a hint of leather. A fine vintage."

rulings.text: The ability of Epicure of Blood triggers just once for each life-gaining event, whether it's 1 life from Ajani's Welcome or 3 life from Revitalize.

Each creature with lifelink dealing combat damage causes a separate life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures you control with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, Epicure of Blood's ability will trigger twice. However, if a single creature you control with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will trigger only once.
If you gain an amount of life "for each" of something, that life is gained as one event and the ability of Epicure of Blood triggers only once.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate won't cause the ability to trigger, even though it caused your team's life total to increase.

cards.originalText: Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: Fell Specter
cards.text:
Flying
When Fell Specter enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, that player loses 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Fell Specter enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Fraying Omnipotence
cards.text: Each player loses half their life, then discards half the cards in their hand, then sacrifices half the creatures they control. Round up each time.
cards.flavor: The Great Mending that healed the Multiverse also unraveled the threads of Nicol Bolas's power.

rulings.text: The amounts that are lost are rounded up, not the amounts kept. For example, a player with 5 life, five cards in hand, and five creatures would lose 3 life, discard three cards, and sacrifice three creatures.

Because the instructions are followed in order, abilities of the creatures a player will sacrifice may modify or trigger on losing life, discarding cards, and/or sacrificing creatures. Abilities that trigger this way will resolve after Fraying Omnipotence is done resolving.

When Fraying Omnipotence resolves, first each player loses the appropriate amount of life at once. Next, the player whose turn it is chooses an appropriate number of cards in hand without revealing them, then each other player in turn order does the same, and then those cards are all discarded simultaneously. Then, the player whose turn it is chooses an appropriate number of creatures they control. Each other player in turn order does the same, knowing choices made by previous players. Finally, all of the chosen creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.

In a Two-Headed Giant game, Fraying Omnipotence causes each player to lose half of their team's life, rounded up. This means that teams at an even life total will have 0 life, and teams at an odd life total will have -1 life. The game then ends in a draw.

cards.originalText: Each player loses half their life, then discards half the cards in their hand, then sacrifices half the creatures they control. Round up each time.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Graveyard Marshal
cards.text: {2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Rise and shine, my dears. We have work to do."
—Isareth the Awakener
cards.originalText: {2}{B}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Hired Blade
cards.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
cards.flavor: "If you want them dead, buy some poison. If you want them to have the worst day of their life before dying, then let's talk price."
cards.originalText: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

cards.name: Infectious Horror
cards.text: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Infectious Horror's ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

cards.originalText: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Infernal Reckoning
cards.text: Exile target colorless creature. You gain life equal to its power.
cards.flavor: "When these intruders are gone, Zendikar will be my throne, my palace, my playground."

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, you don't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Exile target colorless creature. You gain life equal to its power.

cards.name: Infernal Scarring
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has "When this creature dies, draw a card."
cards.flavor: One who is marked by a demon in life is sure to be remembered as one in death.

rulings.text: The player who controlled the creature when it died is the one who will draw a card.
If Infernal Scarring and the enchanted creature are destroyed at the same time, the player will draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has "When this creature dies, draw a card."

cards.name: Isareth the Awakener
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Whenever Isareth the Awakener attacks, you may pay {X}. When you do, return target creature card with converted mana cost X from your graveyard to the battlefield with a corpse counter on it. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

rulings.text: Isareth's triggered ability goes on the stack without a target. While that ability is resolving, you may pay {X}. When you do, a second ability triggers and you pick a target creature card to return. This is different from abilities that say "If you do . . ." in that players may cast spells and activate abilities after mana is paid and the target creature card is chosen, but before that card is returned.
Because all attacking creatures are chosen at once, a creature returned this way can't attack during the same combat as it returns, even if it has haste.
If a card in your graveyard has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

If you somehow remove a corpse counter from a creature Isareth has returned to the battlefield, the replacement effect that will exile it continues to apply. The counter is only to help remind you which creatures will be exiled if they would leave the battlefield.
If Isareth leaves the battlefield, the replacement effect continues to apply. If one of the creatures it returned would leave the battlefield, it'll be exiled instead.
Because to die means to be put into a graveyard from the battlefield, a creature that is exiled instead doesn't "die." Abilities that would trigger when it dies won't trigger.

foreignNames.name: 呼び覚ます者イザレス

cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
Whenever Isareth the Awakener attacks, you may pay {X}. When you do, return target creature card with converted mana cost X from your graveyard to the battlefield with a corpse counter on it. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.

cards.name: Lich's Caress
cards.text: Destroy target creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: A lich must consume mortal souls to feed its eternal life.

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Lich's Caress tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Liliana, Untouched by Death
cards.text:
+1: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard. If at least one of them is a Zombie card, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
−2: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Zombies you control.
−3: You may cast Zombie cards from your graveyard this turn.

rulings.text: The value of X is determined only as Liliana's second ability resolves. If the number of Zombies you control changes later, the target creature's power and toughness won't change.

Casting a Zombie card from your graveyard once Liliana's third ability has resolved follows the normal rules for casting that card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all applicable timing rules.
Once Liliana's third ability has resolved, any Zombie cards in your graveyard may be cast this turn, including Zombie cards that enter your graveyard later in the turn.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Liliana's first ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life and you gain 2 life.

foreignNames.name: Liliana, a salvo de la muerte
死が触れぬ者、リリアナ

cards.originalText:
+1: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard. If at least one of them is a Zombie card, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
−2: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Zombies you control.
−3: You may cast Zombie cards from your graveyard this turn.

cards.name: Liliana's Contract
cards.text:
When Liliana's Contract enters the battlefield, you draw four cards and you lose 4 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control four or more Demons with different names, you win the game.
cards.flavor: Immortality is worth any price.

rulings.text: If you don't control four Demons with different names as your upkeep begins, the second ability of Liliana's Contract won't trigger. You can't take any actions during your turn before your upkeep begins.
If the second ability does trigger, but you no longer control four Demons with different names as the ability resolves, you won't win the game.

cards.originalText:
When Liliana's Contract enters the battlefield, you draw four cards and you lose 4 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control four or more Demons with different names, you win the game.

cards.name: Macabre Waltz
cards.text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Liliana is never one to follow someone else's lead.

rulings.text: If you have no other cards in hand, you'll have to discard one of the creature cards you return to your hand.
You may cast Macabre Waltz targeting one or zero creature cards. You'll still discard a card, even if you target no creature cards.

cards.originalText: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: Many an inventor has collapsed under the pressure to create a flawless design.
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Murder
cards.text: Destroy target creature.
cards.flavor: "It's not work if you enjoy it."
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Nightmare's Thirst
cards.text: You gain 1 life. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
cards.flavor: That feeling of something on your chest is usually sleep paralysis. Occasionally, it's something else.

rulings.text: Nightmare's Thirst counts how much life you've gained this turn, not how much your life total changed. For example, if you've gained 5 life and lost 8 before Nightmare's Thirst resolves, Nightmare's Thirst has you gain 1 more life, then it gives the target creature -6/-6.
If the target creature is an illegal target when Nightmare's Thirst tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain 1 life.

cards.originalText: You gain 1 life. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.

cards.name: Open the Graves
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: It was a night like any other. It would soon become a night no one would ever forget.

rulings.text: If another creature you control dies at the same time that Open the Graves leaves the battlefield, you'll get a Zombie token.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Phylactery Lich
cards.text:
Indestructible
As Phylactery Lich enters the battlefield, put a phylactery counter on an artifact you control.
When you control no permanents with phylactery counters on them, sacrifice Phylactery Lich.

rulings.text: Phylactery Lich's first ability doesn't target the artifact. No player may take actions between the time you choose an artifact and the time you put a phylactery counter on it.

If you control no artifacts as Phylactery Lich enters the battlefield, its first ability won't do anything. As soon as it enters the battlefield, its last ability will trigger (unless you control some other permanent with a phylactery counter on it) and you'll have to sacrifice it.

If Phylactery Lich and an artifact are entering the battlefield under your control at the same time, you can't put a phylactery counter on that artifact. You must choose an artifact you control that's already on the battlefield.

Phylactery Lich's last ability is a "state trigger." Once a state trigger triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again.

Phylactery Lich's last ability checks your permanents for any phylactery counters, not just the specific one that it caused you to put on an artifact. For example, if you control two Phylactery Liches and two different artifacts with phylactery counters, neither Phylactery Lich will be sacrificed if one of those artifacts leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Indestructible
As Phylactery Lich enters the battlefield, put a phylactery counter on an artifact you control.
When you control no permanents with phylactery counters on them, sacrifice Phylactery Lich.

cards.name: Plague Mare
cards.text:
Plague Mare can't be blocked by white creatures.
When Plague Mare enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When it passes, those who sleep dream of sickness and death.

rulings.text: Plague Mare's second ability affects only creatures your opponents control at the time it resolves. Creatures they begin to control later in the turn won't get -1/-1.

cards.originalText:
Plague Mare can't be blocked by white creatures.
When Plague Mare enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ravenous Harpy
cards.text:
Flying
{1}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Harpy.
cards.flavor: A harpy's hoard is a filthy, bloodstained pile of trinkets and corpses.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Harpy.

cards.name: Reassembling Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.originalText: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.
cards.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

rulings.text: Rise from the Grave doesn't overwrite any previous colors or types. Rather, it adds another color and another subtype.
If the creature is normally colorless, it will simply become black. It can't be both black and colorless.

A later effect that changes the affected creature's colors will overwrite that part of Rise from the Grave's effect; the creature will be only the new color. The same is true about an effect that changes the affected creature's types or subtypes.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.name: Skeleton Archer
cards.text: When Skeleton Archer enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"When it comes to killing with precision, a soul is but a hindrance."
—Isareth the Awakener
cards.originalText: When Skeleton Archer enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Skymarch Bloodletter
cards.text:
Flying
When Skymarch Bloodletter enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: From the perpetual shadowsmoke that hung above the ship, a silent form emerged, lips curled with malice and anticipation.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Skymarch Bloodletter enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Sovereign's Bite
cards.text: Target player loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"You have given all to your kingdom, dear knight. Serenity shall be your prize."
—Queen Lian
cards.originalText: Target player loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Stitcher's Supplier
cards.text: When Stitcher's Supplier enters the battlefield or dies, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: No part goes to waste.
cards.originalText: When Stitcher's Supplier enters the battlefield or dies, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Strangling Spores
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Imagine a thousand tiny mushrooms cropping up within your lungs.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Two-Headed Zombie
cards.text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: "Thread the torsos together with angel hair to ensure they will cooperate in battle." —The Stitcher's Tome
cards.originalText: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.name: Vampire Neonate
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: One day, they may be paragons of deadly elegance. For the moment, they possess nothing but thirst.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Vampire Neonate's ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life and you to gain 1 life.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Vampire Sovereign
cards.text:
Flying
When Vampire Sovereign enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Your service shall be rewarded."
—Queen Lian
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Vampire Sovereign enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Walking Corpse
cards.flavor:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: She learned a tragic lesson that day: even the purest can be corrupted when the heart's emotions are twisted.

rulings.text: Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that's untapped or one you already control.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
